It sounds like you're in the mood for something intriguing! If you enjoy a blend of mystery and supernatural elements, I'd recommend giving "Psychic Experiment" a try. Adrienne King and Glenn Morshower deliver captivating performances in this film that will surely test the boundaries of reality.

On the other hand, if you prefer a more dramatic narrative with strong character development, "Downfall" featuring Bruno Ganz is an engaging choice. This movie explores themes of redemption and personal struggle, making for a thought-provoking viewing experience. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend watching "Hitch" if you enjoyed the deeper, more contemplative mood of 'The Right Stuff'. In this film, you'll find a delightful blend of humor and drama as Vincent De Paul portrays Alfred Hitchcock in an exploration of one of cinema history's most intriguing meetings with François Truffaut. Eva Mendes also stars in the movie.

For another compelling watch, "Taxi Driver" offers a gritty portrayal of a taxi driver's descent into chaos and his complex relationship with a young prostitute, played by Jodie Foster. This iconic film is directed by Martin Scorsese and stars Robert De Niro.

I'd highly recommend checking out "The Hateful Eight"! It's a gripping tale set in a Wyoming winter, featuring a diverse cast of characters, including Zoë Bell and Jennifer Jason Leigh. The plot revolves around a bounty hunter and his prisoner seeking shelter, but things quickly become complex and intriguing. Enjoy the suspense!

If you're up for something different, "The Rum Diary" might be worth your time as well. Starring Johnny Depp, it's a fascinating story about an American journalist trying to find balance between island culture and expatriates in Puerto Rico during the 1960s. Enjoy the adventure!
